ok, I figured it out. If you just burn the downloaded iso you can only install ultimate. In order to get the options to choose which edition to install, you need to either extract the iso image or burn the image and then copy all the files and folders to your hard drive. Then, with the copy on your hard drive,  you need to go into the Sources folder and delete ei.cfg. Then burn the files and folders back to DVD making it bootable. Now whether you do an upgrade or clean install, you will be given the option to choose which edition you want to install.

hostage24: No key is required whether doing a clean install or an upgrade. Just uncheck to activate online, then click next and click no when it warns you. Windows will be activated once installed.

http://social.answers.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/w7repair/thread/27a81252-1f7a-4c32-8800-2eb1b5c9b580

When upgrading from Windows Vista to Windows 7 (by choosing Upgrade as install method), the setup installation process of Windows 7 may stop and hang at 62% indefinitely. and you may recieve an error message and it will revert back to your Vista instalation here is the fix.

http://go.microsoft.com/?linkid=9693817

Experienced users can also fix the problem manually by following the steps detailed at the very same support page:

To resolve this problem yourself, follow these steps:

1. Restart the computer. Then, your computer will roll back to Windows Vista.
2. Click Start, right-click Computer, and then click Properties.
3. On the Advanced tab, click Environment Variables.
4. Under System variables, click New.
5. Type MIG_UPGRADE_IGNORE_PLUGINS in the Variable name field.
6. Type IphlpsvcMigPlugin.dll in the Variable value field.
7. Click OK three times to close the dialog boxes.
8. Start the upgrade installation again. 

I hope this helps someone

First I'd like to thank MorerFree for all the work that was done and for posting it for all of us to share! For all you Netbook owners wondering if this is going to work with Atom Intel Processor... YES it worked Perfectly! For the first time EVER installing an OS without having to find the drivers for anything at all! WOW! What a F**king thrill!! I did a CLEAN install of the Windows7 Ultimate version on my ACER ASPIRE ONE 1.6ghz 1gb Ram with an EXTERNAL USB DVD Drive since my NETBOOK has no internal dvd drive. I know there are ways to install this via a USB external drive or USB PENDRIVE by making them bootable but it's  a wise investment to buy an External DVD/Burner ANYWAY  I previously had Dualboot WindowsXP & MacOSX. During the install it shows you all the Partitions on your harddrive and it lets you delete them one by one from there until your left with 1 partion showing the full size of your harddrive and even an option to specifically choose how many GB of your harddrive you'd like to use. I didn't even need to Format the drive! When the install asks for the Serial/Productkey just LEAVE IT BLANK an UNCHECK the ONLY box that is there, if by chance you forget to UNCHECK the box DON'T PANIC just don't give any info on your wireless internet or disconnect your ethernet cable so it won't register automatically to Windows. Just complete the install and you are DONE!!! You DO NOT NEED ANY CRACK OR SERIAL # OR PRODUCT KEY AT ALL!!!! THIS IS "PRE" ACTIVATED ALREADY! In fact there is nothing there to activate. You can't put a serial number even if you WANTED to! You can even do windows updates. This is an ENGISH version but you can download the Language pack with the Mirosoft Update! 

My ONLY question to the MoreFree Team is, since you removed the WAT from this Windows7, does this mean it will still work after March 2010? Please let me know...

Thanks AGAIN!!

KRONIC777 is also my PS3 username! Call of Duty Modern Warfare 2 ROCKS!!!
